intro: Sterculia stigmarota, commonly known as the African sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The tree produces woody capsules that contain numerous small, flat seeds. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
